Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the BEACON Caresystem in Mechanical Ventilation Weaning

Trial_Design.evidence: multicentre, randomised controlled trial included adult ICU patients ventilated for over 24 hours

Participants.evidence: adult ICU patients ventilated for over 24 hours

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either BEACON Caresystem advice (intervention) or usual care (control)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the BEACON Caresystem, a decision support tool, in reducing ventilation duration.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the duration of mechanical ventilation from intubation to successful extubation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between September 2017 and March 2020, 252 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 112 patients due to early termination from COVID-19.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference in ventilation duration was observed. However, the intervention group had fewer adverse events, primarily hypoxaemia, and lower tidal volumes.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events occurred in 9% of the intervention group and 15% of the control group.
